sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A puritane set forth in his lively colours: or, K. James his description of a puritan. Whereunto is added, the round-heads character, with the character of an holy sister. All fitted for the times. James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
[2], 6 p.
Printed for N.B., London : 1642.
"The round-heads character" and "The holy-sisters character" in verse. "A puritan set forth" extracted from the Basilikon doron -- Cf. BM. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aug: 23". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Printed for N.B., London : 1642.
"The round-heads character" and "The holy-sisters character" in verse. "A puritan set forth" extracted from the Basilikon doron -- Cf. BM. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aug: 23". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
